website_summaries.verdict: This is a very comprehensive study guide that covers all areas of the GED, but some may want to invest in a supplemental sample test book.
pros: Includes a wide range of potential test questions
Contains detailed answers and explanations for instant feedback
cons: Strictly a study guide, does not include full-length practice tests or worksheets

customer_reviews.title: Hire a Proofreader
customer_reviews.text: In decades of teaching, I have never encountered a textbook with so many proofreading errors. Misplaced decimal points. Diagrams that do not match the test question they are supposed to match. Answers in the back of the book that do not match the question they are supposed to answer. Proofreading is one difficulty with this book. There is a second difficulty: explanations of strategies often employ complex vocabulary suitable for a teacher's manual but not suitable for high school level students. Clarity and simplicity are sacrificed. There are better books on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. B. D. Massey

customer_reviews.title: Book is clear and consice in it information.
customer_reviews.text: This book is well written and is very easy to understand. I use this book for Inmates and Detainees who are attempting to study for there GED test. Many of them have not been in school or studied for many years. It is great to see that they are able to make headway and understand the program and what they need to study. The points are concise and to the point.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Mallwitz

customer_reviews.title: About teaching GED classes...
customer_reviews.text: This has been invaluable for me. I am not planning to take the GED, I am actually teaching inmates who want to take the GED. So this book serves as the study guide for ME - so I can teach them. My responsibilities for them are math and science. I have a strong math and science background but still need to review topics each week before I teach them. Your book is concise, organized well and goes with me every time I teach.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Allison Herbinger

customer_reviews.title: A GED Instructor Thanks You (a LOT).
customer_reviews.text: I teach GED classes and this book is an absolute lifesaver. I wish it came with perforated sheets but beggars can't be choosers and this book is better then any of their competitors. Those competitors, also, do not offer perforated sheets. My job is a lot easier with this book than it would ever be without it. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great Book!
customer_reviews.text: The way so much information is listed in places, events, etc. It's fantastic. It's so much easier than having to fish out basic information from reading passages. Arrived when it was supposed to and in perfect shape! This guide is much better than the older versions I've had. It's easy to understand and has features I really like. Recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: MaryLee Ennis

customer_reviews.title: I think its easy to read and learn from I’m so happy you guys will be the reason I earn my GED with confident

customer_reviews.title: To read it over a few times and don’t get stuck thinking it is the first answer.
customer_reviews.text: Actually this is the second one I have purchased for other people who have been interested in getting there GED. This is the first one from your company . I like this so much more because it is broke down in terms that they can completely understand. Although there is one part on page 11 in the math section under the unit fractions that doesn’t give a good break down if they don’t understand decimals or changing the fractions to decimals. Although I was able to assist because I knew the old math way to do the break down. Outside of that the book is phenomenal.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Does not give you problems to do. It gives you examples and that was NOT what I was looking for. You should have explained in the details that this workbook is just a study guide and not a workbook. It has two tests in it after you read all of the information and look at the examples but there are no problems in each section for you to work while you are going through the chapters. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a really great book
customer_reviews.text: Very comprehensive. I bought it to aid others in getting their GED. I made a great choice with your book.

customer_reviews.title: We ordered this for our daughter and were very disappointed that there are NO practice worksheets for the concepts ...
customer_reviews.text: Word of warning to any if they may be seeking what we were seeking. We ordered this for our daughter and were very disappointed that there are NO practice worksheets for the concepts being studied. This is ONLY a study guide, and doesn't include any pages of practice work. Possibly others knew what to, or not to, expect, but we may not have purchased it had we known. It does include some good guidance on the concepts of what is being studied, however, which is beneficial in itself. Just no practice for practical application included.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Perfect study guide to use

The things we learn in American schools literally have no sense or purpose in life. We won this and that war, yadda yadda, great book nonetheless.

customer_reviews.title: Book and sample text not the same.
customer_reviews.text: Before I ordered this book, I checked out the sample contents. I was pleased with what I saw so I went ahead and placed my order. Upon receipt of the book, I opened it up to find the contents were different from the sample material shown on the web site. I don't know where the sample material came from, but it was far superior to the book I received. I will be returning it.

customer_reviews.title: Not a user-friendly format
customer_reviews.text: The printing is very small and the layout very dense without enough clarity such as headlines, bold print. Given it's a study guide for GED , I don't think it's user-friendly. However, it does contain information on the elements of the GED.

customer_reviews.title: it works best for my use.
customer_reviews.text: My personal rating for your GED Study Guide 2019 (I rate it at 5) come out of a comparison to a 2011 copy of Master the GED published by Peterson’s and edited by Mark Alan Stewart. Your 2019 issue is much more concentrated and organized in a manner that the instructor can employ in the special environment for which I intend its use: within our county jail, serving inmates who have lots of time on their hands and not much else of value to do with it.

customer_reviews.title: This is not something I would recommend to anyone trying to pass their GED test.
customer_reviews.text: This is not something I would recommend to anyone trying to pass their GED. The authors put things in here that are way harder than the GED actually is. In math it doesn’t explain the problems well..it doesn’t show you how to solve them and they try to have you learn stuff you wouldn’t need for the test. If you’re trying to pass your GED test I would recommend for you to go to classes and take pre tests to see what you need to study on.

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably biased book without relevant information
customer_reviews.text: I am incredibly disappointment in this book. I purchased this for a friend of mine and cannot believe how biased this book is. The practice test does not encompass the majority of the GED test subjects. There wasn't a single question regarding math or science. Almost every question on this "practice test" was a political question. I am returning this book and looking for a book without an agenda. I don't care what your political stance is, you don't need exerts from the communist manifesto to learn the basic skills for life. How this has higher than a 1 star rating is beyond me. Its truly scary how biased this book is.
